Headline: No trains between Clark/Lake and Armitage
ShortDescription: Brown Line service has been temporarily suspended between Clark/Lake and Armitage due to a track condition.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Brown Line service has been temporarily suspended between Clark/Lake and Armitage due to a track condition.

As a result, trains are operating only between Kimball and Armitage at this time.

Shuttle buses have been requested between Clark/Lake and Armitage to provide connecting service.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

These may include Red Line rail service.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Green Line Service Delayed near Clark/Lake
ShortDescription: Green Line trains are standing near Clark/Lake due to a track condition. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Green Line trains are standing near Clark/Lake due to a track condition.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

Harlem-bound Green Line trains have been re-routed to the Inner Loop. Board Harlem-bound Green Line trains on the Orange Line platform side. 

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.
